intro: Solanum nigrum subsp. luteovirescens, commonly known as the yellow-green black nightshade, is a variant of the black nightshade species native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a herbaceous annual plant characterized by its hairy stems and alternate leaves that are typically ovate to elliptic in shape. The flowers are small, yellowish-green, and clustered in umbels, while the fruit is a globose berry that transitions from green to black as it matures. This subspecies is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, and it is known for its toxic properties due to the presence of solanine and other alkaloids.
